intro: Halosarcia indica, commonly known as the Indian halosarcia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable for several years. Halosarcia indica is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
